blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: I Didn't Know I'd Found You
title: I Didn't Know I'd Found You
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2N3j9PW

by EmilyWeaslette

Peter Stark was kidnapped when he was four years old. For the past eleven years, his parents, Tony Stark and Pepper Potts-Stark have been searching for him, but they have slowly been coming to the conclusion that they might not find him. Until Spider-Man is injured during the airport battle in Civil War, and lands in the MedBay. While trying to heal him, Dr. Helen Cho makes the shocking discovery that 15-year-old Peter Parker is not Peter Parker. He is, in fact, the missing Peter Stark.

Words: 932, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Iron Man (Movies)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Characters: Peter Parker, May Parker, Tony Stark, Avengers Team (MCU)
  • Relationships: Peter Parker & Tony Stark, May Parker (Spider-Man) & Peter Parker, Peter Parker & Avengers Team
  • Additional Tags: Peter Parker is Tony Stark’s Biological Child, Tony Stark Has A Heart, Tony Stark Needs a Hug, Hurt Tony Stark, Parent Tony Stark, Tony Stark Has Issues, Tony Stark Feels, Tony Stark-centric, Precious Peter Parker, Peter Parker Needs a Hug, Hurt Peter Parker, Tony Stark Acting as Peter Parker’s Parental Figure, Kidnapped Peter Parker, Kidnapped, mcu - Freeform, Marvel - Freeform, Marvel Cinematic Universe - Freeform, Marvel Universe, Spider-Man - Freeform, Ned Leeds - Freeform, Ned Leeds is a Good Bro, Michelle Jones Is a Good Bro, I Don’t Even Know, I Wrote This Instead of Sleeping, I’m Sorry, How Do I Tag, I’m Bad At Tagging, I Can’t Believe I Wrote This, Avengers Family


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2N3j9PW

body:
Prison AU fic

To those of you who read my Prison AU thing I posted the other day, I had a lot of people ask me if I could continue it.  So I did.  

I posted on A03 because it’s pretty dirty, so the link is here.  It’s not exactly the same, I changed things a little, but I hope you guys like it!

Again, warnings because this time it is actual non-con smut, so. 

Yeah, I hope you enjoy!

summary:
Square:  S3 - Holding Hands
Rating:  G
Warnings:  None
Pairing:  Eddie Brock/Venom/Tony Stark
Summary:   Eddie sees an...
body:
Square:  S3 - Holding Hands

Rating:  G

Warnings:  None

Pairing:  Eddie Brock/Venom/Tony Stark

Summary:  Eddie sees an unexpected person from his past and decides to give him a hand.  My first fill for the @tonystarkbingo this year!

Link:  AO3

Eddie.

“Hmm?” Eddie said absently, trying to walk and read the newspaper without spilling his coffee.  A third hand would be useful but he and Venom had agreed that generally speaking they should avoid terrifying the public without good reason.

Eddie, Venom said again, this time more urgently. What is that?

Eddie’s head was turned up and his gaze focused on something high in the sky over San Francisco. Frowning, Eddie’s vision sharpened and focused far beyond what a normal human could have achieved, and then both the coffee and the newspaper hit the pavement.

“Holy shit, that’s Iron Man!” Eddie said, sprinting towards the bay where Iron Man was fighting what looked like a – a giant dragon?

Who is Iron Man? Venom asked, even as he helped Eddie put on speed and vault over cars that barely had a chance to honk before they were gone again.  Eddie just let him flip through his memories of Iron Man and Tony Stark; he could tell that Venom was lingering with curiosity over the memories of his one night stand with Tony when he was still working with the Daily Planet out of New York City.  At the time, it was kind of Tony’s thing to sleep with the reporters who interviewed him, so even though they had made some damned good memories, memories that Eddie had definitely bookmarked in his spank bank, he had known better than to try to make anything more of that night than a good time.

High in the sky the dragon curled in on itself in a way that seemed impossible and caught Tony in its teeth, shaking him like a dog with a rat before Tony blasted it in the face and it released him with a shriek of rage.  Tony tried to get close enough to get it in the face again but as he dodged its teeth a lucky swipe of its claws sent him tumbling out of the sky.

“Venom!”  But Venom sensed Eddie’s urgency before the words could even leave his mouth and Eddie gave up control as he swept over their body with a rush.  Tony seemed to be tumbling slowly but also too quickly out of the sky, his repulsors firing irregularly and not enough to stabilize him; Venom extended his talons and then they were climbing up a building, leaping from roof to roof in a bid to catch Tony before he hit the ground.  At about the fortieth floor of the Transamerica Pyramid they caught Tony by the wrist with an outflung tentacle, pulling him in close and stopping his fall.  “Gotcha,” they said with satisfaction.

They were debating what to do with him now – put him down on the ground where there was a crowd of people gathering or carry him up to the roof where the dragon was heading their way – with the face to the suit popped open and Tony was looking at them with raised eyebrows.

“Whoa,” he said. “Hi. I’m Iron Man, thanks for the uh, helping hand.” He tried to move his hand but Venom had him gripped tight.

“We are Venom,” they said, and then with a push from Eddie Venom pulled away from his face.  “But you might remember me as Eddie.”

Tony’s eyes narrow and then widened. “Eddie Brock! Daily Planet. We did an interview in what, 2004? You, um, seem a little different than I remember,” he said, eyeing the sharp, needle like teeth framing Eddie’s face.

 “Yeah, September 2004.  Some stuff has happened since then,” Eddie said, shrugging Venom’s massive shoulders. "But it’s a bit of a long story.” Tony fired up his repulsors and they let him go when it was clear that his suit was back under control, all of the teeth mark dents notwithstanding.

“I think I’d like to hear that story,” Tony said.  “Because I remember the article being great but the sex was fantastic.  You know I tried to look you up again but they said you’d transferred to San Francisco. What are you doing in-” Tony looked around and seemed to realize for the first time where he was. “Oh, we’re in San Francisco.  The dragon teleports,” he explained apologetically.   “A few minutes ago we were in Jakarta, I think.” As if it could tell they were talking about it, high above them the dragon shrieked and started diving towards them. “Let me take care of this, and then let’s do lunch and catch up!” Tony said, closing his faceplate.

“How about I help you with this, then we do dinner?” Eddie shouted over the sound of the dragon’s war as Venom crawled over his face again, clearly eager to test themselves against such an enormous foe.

“Sure,” Tony said, voice slightly tinny from the suit’s speakers. “Hop on.” He wavered a little in the air as Venom crawled onto his back, clearly not expecting them to weigh so much, then they were racing towards the diving dragon in a high stakes game of chicken.

We’re keeping him, Venom said with a possessive glee, then there was no time for conversation as they flung themselves at the dragon’s face.

Eddie, Venom said again, this time more urgently. What is that?

Eddie’s head was turned up and his gaze focused on something high in the sky over San Francisco. Frowning, Eddie’s vision sharpened and focused far beyond what a normal human could have achieved, and then both the coffee and the newspaper hit the pavement.

“Holy shit, that’s Iron Man!” Eddie said, sprinting towards the bay where Iron Man was fighting what looked like a – a giant dragon?

Who is Iron Man? Venom asked, even as he helped Eddie put on speed and vault over cars that barely had a chance to honk before they were gone again.  Eddie just let him flip through his memories of Iron Man and Tony Stark; he could tell that Venom was lingering with curiosity over the memories of his one night stand with Tony when he was still working with the Daily Planet out of New York City.  At the time, it was kind of Tony’s thing to sleep with the reporters who interviewed him, so even though they had made some damned good memories, memories that Eddie had definitely bookmarked in his spank bank, he had known better than to try to make anything more of that night than a good time.

High in the sky the dragon curled in on itself in a way that seemed impossible and caught Tony in its teeth, shaking him like a dog with a rat before Tony blasted it in the face and it released him with a shriek of rage.  Tony tried to get close enough to get it in the face again but as he dodged its teeth a lucky swipe of its claws sent him tumbling out of the sky.

“Venom!”  But Venom sensed Eddie’s urgency before the words could even leave his mouth and Eddie gave up control as he swept over their body with a rush.  Tony seemed to be tumbling slowly but also too quickly out of the sky, his repulsors firing irregularly and not enough to stabilize him; Venom extended his talons and then they were climbing up a building, leaping from roof to roof in a bid to catch Tony before he hit the ground.  At about the fortieth floor of the Transamerica Pyramid they caught Tony by the wrist with an outflung tentacle, pulling him in close and stopping his fall.  “Gotcha,” they said with satisfaction.

They were debating what to do with him now – put him down on the ground where there was a crowd of people gathering or carry him up to the roof where the dragon was heading their way – with the face to the suit popped open and Tony was looking at them with raised eyebrows.

“Whoa,” he said. “Hi. I’m Iron Man, thanks for the uh, helping hand.” He tried to move his hand but Venom had him gripped tight.

“We are Venom,” they said, and then with a push from Eddie Venom pulled away from his face.  “But you might remember me as Eddie.”

Tony’s eyes narrow and then widened. “Eddie Brock! Daily Planet. We did an interview in what, 2004? You, um, seem a little different than I remember,” he said, eyeing the sharp, needle like teeth framing Eddie’s face.

 “Yeah, September 2004.  Some stuff has happened since then,” Eddie said, shrugging Venom’s massive shoulders. "But it’s a bit of a long story.” Tony fired up his repulsors and they let him go when it was clear that his suit was back under control, all of the teeth mark dents notwithstanding.

“I think I’d like to hear that story,” Tony said.  “Because I remember the article being great but the sex was fantastic.  You know I tried to look you up again but they said you’d transferred to San Francisco. What are you doing in-” Tony looked around and seemed to realize for the first time where he was. “Oh, we’re in San Francisco.  The dragon teleports,” he explained apologetically.   “A few minutes ago we were in Jakarta, I think.” As if it could tell they were talking about it, high above them the dragon shrieked and started diving towards them. “Let me take care of this, and then let’s do lunch and catch up!” Tony said, closing his faceplate.

“How about I help you with this, then we do dinner?” Eddie shouted over the sound of the dragon’s war as Venom crawled over his face again, clearly eager to test themselves against such an enormous foe.

“Sure,” Tony said, voice slightly tinny from the suit’s speakers. “Hop on.” He wavered a little in the air as Venom crawled onto his back, clearly not expecting them to weigh so much, then they were racing towards the diving dragon in a high stakes game of chicken.

We’re keeping him, Venom said with a possessive glee, then there was no time for conversation as they flung themselves at the dragon’s face.
trail.content:
Square:  S3 - Holding Hands

Rating:  G

Warnings:  None

Pairing:  Eddie Brock/Venom/Tony Stark

Summary:  Eddie sees an unexpected person from his past and decides to give him a hand.  My first fill for the @tonystarkbingo this year!

Link:  AO3

Eddie.

“Hmm?” Eddie said absently, trying to walk and read the newspaper without spilling his coffee.  A third hand would be useful but he and Venom had agreed that generally speaking they should avoid terrifying the public without good reason.

Eddie, Venom said again, this time more urgently. What is that?

Eddie’s head was turned up and his gaze focused on something high in the sky over San Francisco. Frowning, Eddie’s vision sharpened and focused far beyond what a normal human could have achieved, and then both the coffee and the newspaper hit the pavement.

They were debating what to do with him now – put him down on the ground where there was a crowd of people gathering or carry him up to the roof where the dragon was heading their way – with the face to the suit popped open and Tony was looking at them with raised eyebrows.

“Whoa,” he said. “Hi. I’m Iron Man, thanks for the uh, helping hand.” He tried to move his hand but Venom had him gripped tight.

“We are Venom,” they said, and then with a push from Eddie Venom pulled away from his face.  “But you might remember me as Eddie.”

Tony’s eyes narrow and then widened. “Eddie Brock! Daily Planet. We did an interview in what, 2004? You, um, seem a little different than I remember,” he said, eyeing the sharp, needle like teeth framing Eddie’s face.

 “Yeah, September 2004.  Some stuff has happened since then,” Eddie said, shrugging Venom’s massive shoulders. "But it’s a bit of a long story.” Tony fired up his repulsors and they let him go when it was clear that his suit was back under control, all of the teeth mark dents notwithstanding.

What are you doing in-” Tony looked around and seemed to realize for the first time where he was. “Oh, we’re in San Francisco.  The dragon teleports,” he explained apologetically.   “A few minutes ago we were in Jakarta, I think.” As if it could tell they were talking about it, high above them the dragon shrieked and started diving towards them. “Let me take care of this, and then let’s do lunch and catch up!” Tony said, closing his faceplate.

“How about I help you with this, then we do dinner?” Eddie shouted over the sound of the dragon’s war as Venom crawled over his face again, clearly eager to test themselves against such an enormous foe.

“Sure,” Tony said, voice slightly tinny from the suit’s speakers. “Hop on.” He wavered a little in the air as Venom crawled onto his back, clearly not expecting them to weigh so much, then they were racing towards the diving dragon in a high stakes game of chicken.

We’re keeping him, Venom said with a possessive glee, then there was no time for conversation as they flung themselves at the dragon’s face.

blog.description: I write platonic and romantic imagines and fics! involving the Avengers and other Marvel characters. Feel free to request something! Just as a heads up, Imagines I write are small things that are short and sweet and aren’t very descriptive while my Fics are more detailed and story-like.

summary: Summary: He was all for assembling teams. Stealth missions were falling short with his own people, so he decided to take it upon...
body:
New Series

Summary: He was all for assembling teams. Stealth missions were falling short with his own people, so he decided to take it upon himself to grasp upon three people who knew could get the job done and do it well. Of course, that didn’t mean that they’d win every time. That’d be too easy.

Fury’s Angels

Featuring Okoye, Natasha Romanoff, and Wanda Maximoff

Chapter One Coming Soon …

blog.name: theincorrectavengers

blog.description:
Bailey • Canadian • Bisexual

Feel free to send me asks or prompts :)

https://myurls.co/theincorrectavengers

summary: “If you’re nothing without this suit, then you shouldn’t have it.”
body:
“If you’re nothing without this suit, then you shouldn’t have it.”

In Spider-Man Homecoming, we saw Tony take Peters suit away, and the scene goes like this;


Peter says “I just wanted to be like you,” Tony replying “and I wanted you to be better. Okay, it’s not working out, I’m gonna need the suit back.” “For how long?” “Forever.” “No. No-no-no. please? Please? Please? You don’t understand! This is all I have, I’m nothing without this suit.” “If you’re nothing without this suit, then you shouldn’t have it. Okay?”


Tony’s actions are somewhat justified for taking away Peter’s suit. He was worried, he needs Peter to be careful and learn from his mistake. But i feel like the main reason he took Peter’s suit away is because he needed Peter to realize that he didn’t need the suit. The suit doesn’t make Peter who he is, the suit doesn’t even make Spider-Man who he was. Peter makes Spider-Man who he is, with, or without the suit. And he needs Peter to realize that the suit is just a tool, just a small piece of who Spider-Man is. But it doesn’t define who he is. Tony is trying to show Peter that the suit doesn’t make him who he is. He makes the suit. And if Peter thinks the suit makes him who he is, it’s going to mess him up. He’s trying to show Peter that a suit means nothing if you’re not good and courageous. Tony is trying to make Peter remember that he was still Spider-Man before he had the suit. All the suit does is enhance the abilities he already has. In Iron Man 3, we see Tony declaring that whether or not he has his suit, he’s still Ironman and nothing will change that.


And we see another moment like this when Steve Rogers and Tony and arguing. “Yeah, big man in a suit of armour. Take that off and what are you?” And without hesitation, Tony replies, “genius, billionaire, playboy, philanthropist.” Tony knows exactly who he is whether he has that suit or not. Tony takes a jab at Steve by telling him “a hero? Like you? You’re a laboratory experiment, Rogers. Everything special about you came out of a bottle.” All of Steve’s abilities came from the super soldier serum, but his abilities aren’t what makes him either. Even before he received the serum Steve knew who he was. He was a fighter despite lacking good health or strength. He had good, set morales and he never faltered when it came to doing the right thing. All the Avengers know who they are and they know that they’re suits and abilities aren’t what make them heroes. Which is exactly what Tony is trying to show/teach Peter.


People may have seen Tony taking Peter’s suit away as unnecessary and cruel, but Tony did the right thing. If he hadn’t have done that, Peter wouldn’t have realized that the suit is what makes him a hero. He realizes that his morals, heart and actions make him Spider-Man and nothing else. Tony wasn’t being selfish or cold, he was being a good teacher to Peter. Thank you for coming to my TED talk-

tags: you guys don't know how hard it is for me to post what i write and how anxious it makes me 😬😅
summary: The One Thing I Can't Live Without - Coquelicot7 - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
body:
The One Thing I Can’t Live Without - Coquelicot7 - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]

Summary: Tony and Pepper’s relationship, from post AOU to Endgame. The breakup, the reunion, the engagement and - spoiler! - the wedding. However Endgame ends, a wedding will happen in this fic.

Had posted this shortly after Homecoming, then deleted it because I’m too self-conscious about my writing. I want to try and complete it, so here it is again. 😊

body:
Peter: Mister Stark, truth or dare?
Tony: Truth!
Peter: Was the moon landing of 1969 faked?
Tony: W-what?
Michelle: Answer the question, Iron Man
